intro: Silaus tenuifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sida, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Silaus tenuifolius is used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and analgesic properties.
